notes:notes.xhtml:p: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting configures the elevation requirements for logged-on administrators to complete a task that requires raised privileges.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode" to "Prompt for consent on the secure desktop".
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: The more secure option for this setting, "Prompt for credentials on the secure desktop", would also be acceptable.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-SO-000410

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 User Account Control must automatically deny standard user requests for elevation.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: The organization requires users to reauthenticate upon organization-defined circumstances or situations requiring reauthentication.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting controls the behavior of elevation when requested by a standard user account.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users" to "Automatically deny elevation requests".

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-SO-000420

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 User Account Control must be configured to detect application installations and prompt for elevation.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting requires Windows to respond to application installation requests by prompting for credentials.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation" to "Enabled".

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-SO-000430

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 User Account Control (UAC) must only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: UAC is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting configures Windows to only allow applications installed in a secure location on the file system, such as the Program Files or the Windows\System32 folders, to run with elevated privileges.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations" to "Enabled".

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-SO-000440

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 User Account Control must run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode, enabling UAC.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: The organization requires users to reauthenticate upon organization-defined circumstances or situations requiring reauthentication.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting enables UAC.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode" to "Enabled".

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-SO-000450

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 User Account Control (UAC) must virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: UAC is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting configures non-UAC-compliant applications to run in virtualized file and registry entries in per-user locations, allowing them to run.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations" to "Enabled".

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UC-000010

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 must preserve zone information when saving attachments.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Attachments from outside sources may contain malicious code. Preserving zone of origin (Internet, intranet, local, restricted) information on file attachments allows Windows to determine risk.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Do not preserve zone information in file attachments

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: The default behavior is for Windows to mark file attachments with their zone information.
If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: User Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Attachment Manager >> "Do not preserve zone information in file attachments" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000010

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller" user right may be able to retrieve the credentials of other accounts from Credential Manager.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller" to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000020

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Act as part of the operating system user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Act as part of the operating system" user right can assume the identity of any user and gain access to resources that the user is authorized to access. Any accounts with this right can take complete control of a system.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Act as part of the operating syste

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Act as part of the operating system" to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000030

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Allow log on locally user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Allow log on locally" user right can log on interactively to a system.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Allow log on locally

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Allow log on locally"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000040

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Back up files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Back up files and directories" user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Back up files and directories

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Back up files and directories"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Create a pagefile user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Create a pagefile" user right can change the size of a pagefile, which could affect system performance.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create a pagefile"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000060

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Create a token object user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Create a token object" user right allows a process to create an access token. This could be used to provide elevated rights and compromise a system.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Create a token object

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create a token object" to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Create global objects user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Create global objects" user right can create objects that are available to all sessions, which could affect processes in other users' sessions.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create global objects"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000080

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Create permanent shared objects user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Create permanent shared objects" user right could expose sensitive data by creating shared objects.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Create permanent shared objects

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create permanent shared objects"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Create symbolic links user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Create symbolic links" user right can create pointers to other objects, which could expose the system to attack.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create symbolic links"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:
Systems that have the Hyper-V role will also have "Virtual Machines" given this user right. If this needs to be added manually, enter it as "NT Virtual Machine\Virtual Machines".

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Debug programs: user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Debug programs" user right can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel, providing complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components. This right is given to Administrators in the default configuration.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for Computer
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Debug programs"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000110

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Force shutdown from a remote system user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Force shutdown from a remote system" user right can remotely shut down a system, which could result in a denial of service.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Force shutdown from a remote system

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Force shutdown from a remote system"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Generate security audits user right must only be assigned to Local Service and Network Service.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Generate security audits" user right specifies users and processes that can generate Security Log audit records, which must only be the system service accounts defined.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Generate security audits"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000130

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Impersonate a client after authentication user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Impersonate a client after authentication" user right allows a program to impersonate another user or account to run on their behalf. An attacker could use this to elevate privileges.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Impersonate a client after authentication

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Impersonate a client after authentication"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Increase scheduling priority: user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Increase scheduling priority" user right can change a scheduling priority, causing performance issues or a denial of service.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Increase scheduling priority" to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000150

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Load and unload device drivers user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Load and unload device drivers" user right allows a user to load device drivers dynamically on a system. This could be used by an attacker to install malicious code.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Load and unload device drivers

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Load and unload device drivers"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000160

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Lock pages in memory user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Lock pages in memory" user right allows physical memory to be assigned to processes, which could cause performance issues or a denial of service.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Lock pages in memory

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Lock pages in memory"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000170

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Manage auditing and security log user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Protect audit information from unauthorized access.
Protect audit information from unauthorized modification.
Protect audit information from unauthorized deletion.
Allow organization-defined personnel or roles to select the event types that are to be logged by specific components of the system.

Provide the capability for organization-defined individuals or roles to change the logging to be performed on organization-defined system components based on organization-defined selectable event criteria within organization-defined time thresholds.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Manage auditing and security log" user right can manage the security log and change auditing configurations. This could be used to clear evidence of tampering.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029, SRG-OS-000063-GPOS-00032, SRG-OS-000337-GPOS-00129

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Manage auditing and security log

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Manage auditing and security log"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000180

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Modify firmware environment values user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Modify firmware environment values" user right can change hardware configuration environment variables. This could result in hardware failures or a denial of service.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Modify firmware environment values

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Modify firmware environment values"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000190

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Perform volume maintenance tasks user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Perform volume maintenance tasks" user right can manage volume and disk configurations. This could be used to delete volumes, resulting in data loss or a denial of service.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Perform volume maintenance tasks

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Perform volume maintenance tasks"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Profile single process user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Profile single process" user right can monitor non-system processes performance. An attacker could use this to identify processes to attack.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Profile single process"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000210

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2019 Restore files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Restore files and directories" user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data. It could also be used to overwrite more current data.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Restore files and directories

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Restore files and directories"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: WN19-UR-000220

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

Accounts with the "Take ownership of files or other objects" user right can take ownership of objects and make changes.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:ident: CIS Recommendation: Take ownership of files or other objects

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Take ownership of files or other objects"
